member.name: M:Infragistics.CoreUtilities.BinarySearch``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},``0,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Helper method for performing a binary search of a sorted list
member.typeparam: The type of items in the list
member.param: The sorted list to be searched
The item to look for
The comparer used to perform the search
False for a standard binary search. True if the should be ignored in the search. This is useful where the item's sort criteria may have changed to find out where the item should be moved to.
member.returns: The index where the item in the list. If the item does not exist then it returns the bitwise complement. In the case where is true, the index of the item will be returned if it exists at the correct location otherwise the bitwise complement of where it should be. Note the complement may need to be decremented if doing a move and the item is before the new index.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.ActiveSelectionCellRangeFormat
member.summary: Returns an object used to get the formatting of the and where modifications are applied to the entire .

remarks.p: Any changes made to this object will affect all the objects in the selection. So for example, the Font.Name may return "Arial" because the active cell has that as its resolved font name even though the other cells are using a different font but if you set the Font.Name of this object to "Arial" then all the objects affected by the selection will have their Font.Name updated to that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.IsInEndMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the control is in "End mode".

remarks.p: End mode is a mode that affects certain keyboard navigation such as navigating with the arrow keys. For example when in end mode and one presses the right arrow, the will be changed to be the first cell to the right of the current ActiveCell that has a value (even if the value is ""). If there were no cells to the right with a value then it would activate the right most cell in that row. End mode will end automatically such as when one presses an arrow key.

member.summary: Invoked when the is about to end the in-place editing of the .

remarks.p: Note: Because the is a dependency property this event may occur after the ActiveCell property has changed. The cell provided to the event will match the cell whose value is actually being edited and is provided in the event arguments.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.EditModeValidationError
member.summary: Invoked when the is exiting edit mode and the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's .

remarks.p: The EditModeValidationError is raised while exiting edit mode if the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's . Since the rule needs to evaluate the value of the cell and potentially other cell's in the Worksheet, the value is first applied to the cell(s) and then is validated. By default if the event is not handled and the is true, a message box will be displayed to the end user to determine what action to take. One can handle this event and specify the action that should be taken using the .
Note: The validation rule will not be evaluated if edit mode is being cancelled such as when the user presses Escape to cancel edit.
Note: The will default to AcceptChange if the ShowErrorMessageForInvalidValue of the is false; otherwise it will default to ShowPrompt.
Note: Like Microsoft Excel, only the validation rule of the active cell is considered even if the update is affecting other cells in the selection.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.EditRangePasswordNeeded

member.summary: Invoked when a change has been made to the that might require a save.

remarks.p: Note: This event is invoked asynchronously with regards to the change(s) that have occurred. Also some changes alone are not considered to dirty the Workbook even though it does change state on the Workbook or one of its subobjects. An example of that would be a zoom type operation (e.g. changing the ).

member.summary: Returns bit flags that signify the current editing state of the control.
member.remarks: The CurrentState property is used primarily in conjunction with the KeyActionMappings property and the method to return information about the state of the control with regards to user interaction. The setting of the CurrentState property indicates which object has focus in the control, whether the user has placed the control into edit mode, and other information such as whether a combo box is dropped down or whether a row is expanded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.GesturesEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the control handles touch input digitizer gestures.

remarks.p: When gestures are enabled, the control responds to pan gestures by scrolling and/or lasso selection of rows. It also responds to the press-and-hold and press-and-tap gestures by displaying its ContextMenu.

Additional gesture support is typically provided by the operating system, i.e., tap gestures are translated into mouse messages, which are handled by the control in the same manner that actual mouse messages are handled. This property does not affect the gesture support provided by the operating system.
Setting this property to a non-default value overrides the value of the static GesturesEnabled property exposed by the UltraControlBase class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheet.GesturesEnabledResolved
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether gestures are enabled for this control.

member.summary: Border at the bottom edge of the range.

member.summary: Horizontal border for all cells within the center excluding the outside edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.InsideVertical
member.summary: Vertical border for all cells within the center excluding the outside edge of the range.

member.summary: Border along the inside of the range. This is equivalent to choosing InsideVertical and InsideHorizontal

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.AllBorder

member.summary: Gets or sets the indent in units of average character widths.

member.exception: The assigned value is not -1 and is outside the valid indent level range of 0 and 250.
member.value: The indent in units of average character widths or -1 to use the default indent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

remarks.p: The Locked valid is used in Excel file only if the associated or is protected. Otherwise the value is ignored.

member.value: The valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the cell content in degrees.

remarks.p: Cell text rotation, in degrees; 0 90 is up 0 90 degrees, 91 180 is down 1 90 degrees, and 255 is vertical.

member.value: The rotation of the cell content in degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

remarks.p: If True, the size of the cell font will shrink so all data fits within the cell.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in a cell.
member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The vertical alignment of the content in a cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

remarks.p: If True, and the row associated with the cell has a default , the row's height will automatically be increased to fit wrapped content.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode
member.summary: Enumeration used to indicate the selection is updated when one interacts with the control via the mouse or keyboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.Normal
member.summary: The selection is replaced when dragging the mouse to select a cell or range of cells. Similarly when navigating via the keyboard a new selection is created. One may add a new range by holding the Ctrl key and using the mouse and one may alter the selection range containing the active cell by holding the Shift key down while clicking with the mouse or navigating with the keyboard such as with the arrow keys.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.ExtendSelection
member.summary: The selection range in the representing the active cell is updated as one uses the mouse to select a cell or navigating via the keyboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.AddToSelection
member.summary: New cell ranges are added to the without needing to hold down the ctrl key when dragging via the mouse and a range is added with the first arrow key navigation after entering the mode. One can enter the mode by pressing Shift+F8.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellRight
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell to the right of the active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellLeft
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell to the left of the active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellAbove
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell above the active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellBelow
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell below the active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellWithDataLeft
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell to the left of the active cell that has data or the first cell in the row if there are none with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellWithDataRight
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell to the right of the active cell that has data or the last cell in the row if there are none with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellWithDataAbove
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell above the active cell that has data or the first cell in the column if there are none with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectCellWithDataBelow
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the cell below the active cell that has data or the last cell in the column if there are none with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectEdgeCellWithDataLeft
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the farthest contiguous cell with data to the left of the active cell. If the active cell has no data or the cell to the left does not have data, it will navigate to the start of the next cell that has data in that direction or the first cell in the row if there are no more cells with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectEdgeCellWithDataRight
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the farthest contiguous cell with data to the right of the active cell. If the active cell has no data or the cell to the right does not have data, it will navigate to the start of the next cell that has data in that direction or the last cell in the row if there are no more cells with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectEdgeCellWithDataAbove
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the farthest contiguous cell with data above the active cell. If the active cell has no data or the cell above does not have data, it will navigate to the start of the next cell that has data in that direction or the first cell in the column if there are no more cells with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SelectEdgeCellWithDataBelow
member.summary: Selects from the active cell to the farthest contiguous cell with data below the active cell. If the active cell has no data or the cell below does not have data, it will navigate to the start of the next cell that has data in that direction or the last cell in the column if there are no more cells with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.ToggleSplitPanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove resizable split areas that are separately scrollable. If the worksheet currently has split areas then the splits will be removed. If the worksheet has frozen areas they will be converted to splits. Otherwise it will create split areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.ToggleFreezePanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove frozen areas. If the worksheet currently has frozen areas then they will be removed. If the worksheet currently has unfrozen splits then they will be converted to frozen splits. Otherwise it will create frozen areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.FreezeFirstRow
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible row will be frozen at the top and the bottom area can scroll from the next row until the last row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.FreezeFirstColumn
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible column will be frozen at the left and the right area can scroll from the next column until the last column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.UltraSpreadsheetAction.SnapColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the width of the left row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.ActiveSelectionCellRangeFormat
member.summary: Returns an object used to get the formatting of the and where modifications are applied to the entire .

remarks.p: Any changes made to this object will affect all the objects in the selection. So for example, the Font.Name may return "Arial" because the active cell has that as its resolved font name even though the other cells are using a different font but if you set the Font.Name of this object to "Arial" then all the objects affected by the selection will have their Font.Name updated to that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.IsInEndMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the control is in "End mode".

remarks.p: End mode is a mode that affects certain keyboard navigation such as navigating with the arrow keys. For example when in end mode and one presses the right arrow, the will be changed to be the first cell to the right of the current ActiveCell that has a value (even if the value is ""). If there were no cells to the right with a value then it would activate the right most cell in that row. End mode will end automatically such as when one presses an arrow key.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.EditModeValidationError
member.summary: Invoked when the is exiting edit mode and the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's .

remarks.p: The EditModeValidationError is raised while exiting edit mode if the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's . Since the rule needs to evaluate the value of the cell and potentially other cell's in the Worksheet, the value is first applied to the cell(s) and then is validated. By default if the event is not handled and the is true, a message box will be displayed to the end user to determine what action to take. One can handle this event and specify the action that should be taken using the .
Note: The validation rule will not be evaluated if edit mode is being cancelled such as when the user presses Escape to cancel edit.
Note: The will default to AcceptChange if the ShowErrorMessageForInvalidValue of the is false; otherwise it will default to ShowPrompt.
Note: Like Microsoft Excel, only the validation rule of the active cell is considered even if the update is affecting other cells in the selection.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.EditRangePasswordNeeded
member.summary: Invoked when the is performing an operation on a protected Worksheet and there is a single range that may be unlocked to allow the operation to be performed.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.WorkbookDirtied
member.summary: Invoked when a change has been made to the that might require a save.

remarks.p: Note: This event is invoked asynchronously with regards to the change(s) that have occurred. Also some changes alone are not considered to dirty the Workbook even though it does change state on the Workbook or one of its subobjects. An example of that would be a zoom type operation (e.g. changing the ).

member.summary: Sets the specified borders for the associated range to the specified style and color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.RangeWorksheetCellFormatBase.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.FormulaBar.Expanded
member.summary: Gets/sets the expanded state of the formula bar.
member.remarks: The height of the formula bar is measured in lines of text. When collapsed, the formula text box will be one line of text high. When expanded, the formula bar will adjust it's height such that the formula textbox can fit a number of lines as determined by the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.FormulaBar.FormulaTextBoxAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets the appearance used to render the formula text box.

member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether an object has been created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinSpreadsheet.FormulaBar.HeightInLines
member.summary: Gets/sets the height of the formula bar when expanded is true. The height is measuring in lines of text.
member.remarks: The height is measured in lines. A setting of 1 means the formula bar textbox is tall enough to fit a single line of text. A setting of 2 means the formula bar is tall enough to fit two lines of text, and so on. /// The HeightInLines is only honored when the property is true. When Expanded is false, the HeightInLines alway resolves to 1.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleSplitPanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove resizable split areas that are separately scrollable. If the worksheet currently has split areas then the splits will be removed. If the worksheet has frozen areas they will be converted to splits. Otherwise it will create split areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleFreezePanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove frozen areas. If the worksheet currently has frozen areas then they will be removed. If the worksheet currently has unfrozen splits then they will be converted to frozen splits. Otherwise it will create frozen areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstRow
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible row will be frozen at the top and the bottom area can scroll from the next row until the last row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstColumn
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible column will be frozen at the left and the right area can scroll from the next column until the last column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Removes the vertical split and sets the LeftPaneWidth of the UnfrozenPaneSettings to 0.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the width of the left row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Removes the horizontal split and sets the TopPaneHeight of the UnfrozenPaneSettings to 0.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveScrollRegionSplits
member.summary: Removes both the horizontal and vertical splits so that there is only a single scrolling region remaining.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapScrollRegionSplits
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top and left scrolling regions such that they are aligned to the edge or a row and column respectively.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.DeleteRows
member.summary: Removes rows associated with the current selection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.InsertRows
member.summary: Inserts rows before the rows associated with the current selection. If multiple rows are selected then multiple rows will be inserted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.DeleteColumns
member.summary: Removes columns associated with the current selection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.InsertColumns
member.summary: Inserts columns before the columns associated with the current selection. If multiple columns are selected then multiple columns will be inserted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.Normal
member.summary: The selection is replaced when dragging the mouse to select a cell or range of cells. Similarly when navigating via the keyboard a new selection is created. One may add a new range by holding the Ctrl key and using the mouse and one may alter the selection range containing the active cell by holding the Shift key down while clicking with the mouse or navigating with the keyboard such as with the arrow keys.

member.summary: New cell ranges are added to the without needing to hold down the ctrl key when dragging via the mouse and a range is added with the first arrow key navigation after entering the mode. One can enter the mode by pressing Shift+F8.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.ExcelSheetPaneManager.BringIntoView(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetPane,Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCell,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Brings the specified portion of the row and/or column into view at the specified offset within the viewable area.
member.param: The pane in which to perform the scroll operation or null to use the ActivePane
The row/column that are to be brought into view.

A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the relative offset within the viewable that the column should be positioned. 0 represents the left most edge of the viewable area and 1.0 represents the right most edge of the viewable area.
A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the relative position of the cell at the specified . 0 represents the left edge of the cell and 1 represents the right edge.

A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the relative offset within the viewable that the row should be positioned. 0 represents the top most edge of the viewable area and 1.0 represents the bottom most edge of the viewable area.
A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the relative position of the cell at the specified . 0 represents the top edge of the cell and 1 represents the bottom edge.

member.summary: Updates the scroll offset if the specified cell is not fully in view giving preference to the leading edge of the cell.
member.param: The pane in which to bring the cell into view or null to use the ActivePane
The cell range to evaluate
True to igore the leading/trailing row/column if they are only partially in view; otherwise false to consider those items in view.
member.returns: True if the range was brought into view.
